post.description: Create Loan applications endpoint available on Lender to be used by LA

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This is the response for Create Loan Applications but invoked by the lender. No offers are rolled out as part of this API. If the lender system finds preliminary information sufficient for doing the loan processing, it will send “PROCESSING” as the status. Otherwise, it can reject the application citing a reason for the same.

requestBody.description: Response by lender to LA for create bulk loan application request

post.description:
Create consent handle with Account Aggregator | This API is used to request the lenders to send a consent request for fetching the bank account statements, GST historical data.
The lender (FIU) checks with the AA and creates a consent handle internally once this API is triggered

requestBody.description: Request by LA to lender to get consent handle with Account Aggregator

200.description: Acknowledgement by Lender to LA for Consent Handle Request

post.description: Invoked by lender to send consent handle created in Account Aggregator
Invoked by LA to inform Lenders of the consent journey state once the customer has interacted with Account Aggregator
Invoked by Lender to get consent handle status from LA

consentHandle.description: Consent handle created during loan applications request processing

post.description: Invoked by LA to send consent status to Lender
The LA sends this request to the lender to get the list of offers that the lender is willing to provide for the loan applications already shared.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the lender informing the borrower regarding the various loan offers that have been generated corresponding to each of the loan applications. This is a bulk API, where multiple loan offers can be sent to the borrower in one shot.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the BA informing the lender regarding the additional documents that are required to be submitted by the borrower for a particular loan application with the Action Required status in the Generate Offers Response API.

items.description: Documents that are required to be submitted by the borrower

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by returning an offer if the documents suffice the requirement or the lender can return another action required for any additional information required.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA to inform the lender about the offer that the borrower has chosen for a particular loan application.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the lender and is the asynchronous response to Set Offer Request API.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This  API is called by LA to initiate the KYC process of the borrower after successfully accepting the final offer. The lender is supposed to return the url, where the borrower will be completing the KYC process.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the lender in response to trigger KYC requests. The lender returns the url for KYC details submission. The KYC process will be carried out on the lender server.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This Api is called by the Lender on the KYC Partner to initiate KYC.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This Api is called by the the KYC Partner on the Lender. This response may contain additional documents collected by the KYC Partner on behalf of the Lender.

items.description: Additional documents collected by the KYC Partner on behalf of the Lender.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by LA to get the KYC status. This API will be triggered just after the user completes the KYC process.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the lender to inform the status of the KYC process. Lender is also supposed to inform the LA about the action required for completing the KYC.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by Lender on the KYC Partner to get the KYC status.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the KYC Partner on the Lender to inform the status of the KYC process.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: Loan agreement request

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: Loan agreement Response

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: SMS Format for the OTP [#] {6Digit OTP} is the One Time Password (OTP) to complete the loan process with {Lender Name}. {appToken} >- Eg- 467866 is the One Time Password (OTP) to complete the loan process with ABC Bank. \#0aBCD7DMr7s >- This API is invoked by the LA when the user agrees to the terms of the agreement.The Asynchronous response for this API should include the lender sending an OTP to the borrower’s phone number

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: SMS Format for the OTP [#] {6Digit OTP} is the One Time Password (OTP) to complete the loan process with {Lender Name}. {appToken} >- Eg- 467866 is the One Time Password (OTP) to complete the loan process with ABC Bank. \#0aBCD7DMr7s >- This API is invoked by the Lender when the Lender triggers the credential verification process from the borrower.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA when the user enters the OTP received on the mobile number and agrees to the terms of the agreement. The asynchronous response for this API should include the lender acknowledging the receipt of OTP and verifying if the user has entered the correct OTP that was shared by the lender.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the Lender  when the OTP entered by the user is shared through the LA. This API acknowledges the receipt of OTP and verifies if the user has entered the correct OTP that was shared by the lender on the mobile number associated with the disbursement account.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA once the borrower completes successful signing of the loan agreement to create the actual loan in the lender’s system.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This method is called be the Lender when the Grant Loan processing is completed. This informs the borrower about the status of the loan in the lender system. Upon successful creation of a loan in the system, the lender returns all the details of the loan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the BA to inform the lender system about the details of the repayment plan that will be used by the borrower.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the lender to the BA giving the payment url where he can enter details of repayment.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by BA to check the status of a previously initiated set repayment plan request. This API is called once the payment page of the lender is loaded and the borrower choses a repayment method associated with the chosen repayment plan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.summary: Set Repayment Plan Status Response / Webhook
post.description: This API is used by lenders to inform BA about the status of a previously initiated set Repayment.The API returns the status of the repayment plan that the borrower has chosen. In case, the borrower has chosen e-mandate as the repayment method in payment page url, the status of the repayment plan becomes ACTIVE only after successful authorization of the e-mandate on the PSP by the borrower.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA to inform the lender about the disbursement account that the borrower has chosen.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the lender to inform the LA regarding whether the lender has successfully set the disbursement account which was sent in SetDisbursementAccountRequest.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is to be used when the borrower wants the money to be disbursed immediately.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is to be used when the borrower wants the money to be disbursed immediately.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is to be used by LA to check the status of a previously initiated disbursement request.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is the response given by lender for  a trigger Disbursement Status Request.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA to inform the lender to trigger a repayment. This API will not be called when payment is routed to lender via collection agent.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the lender to the LA giving the lender payment page url from where the borrower can make the payment. Lender also generates an id for the payment which becomes the reference for LA to check the status of repayment.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by LA to check the status of a previously initiated repayment transaction. In the case where collection is handled by Collection Management System (CMS), once the LA receives payment confirmation (including transaction reference number) from the Collection Management System, LA will send a request to the lender to check if a payment has been credited against the transaction Reference Number.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by BA to check the status of a previously initiated repayment transaction. In the case where collection is handled by Collection Management System (CMS), once the BA receives payment confirmation (including transaction reference number) from the Collection Management System, BA will send a request to the lender to check if a payment has been credited against the transaction Reference Number.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by lenders to inform LA about the status of a repayment handled directly by the lender (Triggered on Lender side - Payment on the branch or auto E-Mandate repayment).

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA when the LA wants to get the details of the loan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This method is called by the Lender and it returns all the details of the loan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA when the LA wants to get the details of the loan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA when the LA wants to get the details of the loan.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This method is called by the LA to get the account statement for the loan for a specified period. If the start and end dates are blank, it will return the entire Loan Statement.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This method is called by the BA to get the account statement for the loan for a specified period. If the start and end dates are blank, it will return the entire Loan Statement.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA to get the summary of the loan as of the current date.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the LA once the borrower completes successful signing of the loan agreement to create the actual loan in the lender’s system.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint is initiated by the LA on the Disbursement partner to get all the products available for the borrower.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint is initiated by the Disbursement partner on the LA as a response to Get Disbursement Options returning all Disbursement Products available.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint can be initiated by LA / Lender on the disbursement partner to get the details of a specific product

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint is initiated by the DisbursementPartner in response to GetDisbursementProductDetailsRequest providing the details of a specific product.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by Lender on the Collections Partner to check the status of a previously initiated repayment transaction. In the case where collection is handled by Collection Management System (CMS), once the Collection Agent receives payment confirmation (including transaction reference number) from the Collection Management System, Collections Partner will send a request to the lender to check if a payment has been credited against the transaction Reference Number.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is used by Collections Partner on the Lender to check the status of a previously initiated repayment transaction. In the case where collection is handled by Collection Management System (CMS), once the Collection Partner receives payment confirmation (including transaction reference number) from the Collection Management System, Collections Partner will send a request to the lender to check if a payment has been credited against the transaction Reference Number.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint is initiated by the LA on the Collections Partner before the Set Repayment Plan request to present the borrower with the available repayment methods.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This endpoint is initiated by the Collections partner on the LA as a response to Get Payment Methods returning all Collection Options available.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the Lender to inform the Collections partner to trigger a repayment. This API will only be called when payment is routed to lender via collection agent.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is invoked by the collections partner to the Lender. The collections partner generates a collection id which will be used by the Lender to query the status of collections.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by lender to KYC partner initiate the KYC process of the borrower after successfully accepting the final offer.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the KYS partnet in response to initiate KYC requests. The partner returns the next step for KYC details submission. The KYC process will be carried out by the partner.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the KYC partner in response to complete KYC response.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by Lender to get the KYC status from partner. This API will be triggered just after the user completes the KYC process.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This API is called by the KYC partnet in response to initiate KYC response.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.summary: Get Derived Data Schema by schema id
post.description: Accepts a get Derived Data Schema Request to be used called by the Lender

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This api returns the expected schema from the derived data provider to the lender

requestBody.description: Response by Derived Data Provider to Lender containing the requested Schema

schema.description: The schema object defining the data schema and identifier schema

post.summary: Start Fetch of Derived Data by identifiers and schema id
post.description: Accepts a Fetch request for Derived Data with the help of Schema Id and identifiers sent in the request. This api will be called by the lender on the Derived Data Provider.

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

post.description: This api returns the expected data from the derived data provider to the lender

requestBody.description: Response by Derived Data Provider to Lender containing the requested derived data

MetaData.title: metadata
MetaData.description: Metadata specific to each API request.

originatorOrgId.description: The organisation id on the Participant Registry.

originatorParticipantId.description: The participant id on the Participant Registry. This will be different for every role under the same organisation.

requestId.description: UUID used to tie request and response and for idempotency

ProductData.title: productData
ProductData.description: Product Metadata specific to each API request.

productId.description: The product id on the Product Registry.

productNetworkId.description: The product network id on the Product Registry.

ExtensibleData.description: This API schema is for additional keys & values according to specific need. User can add JSON objects as per the requirements.

aaIdentifier.description: For AA based flows, account aggregator identifier will be provided by the borrower

Response.description: Status of response. Whether success or has encountered error

createdDate.description: The time when the loan application was created

loanApplicationId.description: UUID for the loan application. Generated by LA

offers.description: Offers given by lender for a loan application

description.description: A short description of the loan application

url.description: For any additional data  that needs to be passed as a link

extensibleData.description: For any additional data that needs to be added

rejectionDetails.description: To be filled if the status of the loan is REJECTED. This object will have the details of why the loan application was rejected

actionRequired.description: To be filled if the status of the loan is ACTION_REQUIRED. This object captures the details of any action that the lender wants the borrower to do

data.description: Data for different type will be defined in later version of APIs. As of now, LA can define it as per their requirement

examples: Using various species of worms, usually red wigglers, white worms, and other earthworms, to create a mixture of decomposing vegetable or food waste.
